question.body: Under what conditions would you expect vasodilation to occur in a tissue?

part.explanation: Vasodilation can occur in response to neural regulation or chemicals signaling the increasing demands of a tissue or an organ. It can be because the tissue of the organ requires more oxygen. Or, it may be due to the demand for glucose or lipids that are being used up due to the high rate of metabolic activities. An example would be vasodilation at the skeletal muscles during strenuous exercise.
